TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DataServiceStreamResponse extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Represents a response from WCF Data Services that contains binary data as a stream.
Gets the header field for the response stream.
Docs.value: The contents of the header field.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the `Content-Disposition` header is not present in the response, the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse.ContentDisposition%2A> property returns `null`.

Docs.summary: Gets the content type of the response stream.
Docs.value: The content type of the response stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the `Content-Type` header is not present in the response, the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse.ContentDisposition%2A> property returns `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Call the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse.Dispose%2A> method when you have finished using the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse>. This releases resources held by the object. You should always do this to release the resources held by the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse>; otherwise, the consumed resources will not be released until after the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method on the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse> object.
After the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse.Dispose%2A> method is called and all references to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse> are released, the memory used can be reclaimed by garbage collection.
You cannot use <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse> after calling the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse.Dispose%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of headers from the response.
Docs.value: The headers collection from the response message as a object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The response is a <xref:System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary%602> object that contains key-value pairs of strings for each header in the response.

Docs.summary: Gets the binary property data from the data service as a binary stream.
Docs.value: The stream that contains the binary property data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a network errors occurs while reading from this stream, an error is raised.
The returned <xref:System.IO.Stream> is read-only.
You must call either the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse.Dispose%2A> method on the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse> or the <xref:System.IO.Stream.Close%2A> method on the <xref:System.IO.Stream>. Otherwise, the network connection remains open and unavailable to other applications.
The <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse.GetResponseStream%2A> method is used to access the stream.
